intro: Scleria nutans, commonly known as the nodding sedges, is a member of the Cyperaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its grass-like appearance with triangular stems and whorled leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in spikelets. Scleria nutans is often found in wet or moist habitats such as marshes, swamps, and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
